We believe that medicine should be holistic—finding root causes of disease and guiding patients through evidence-based natural healing. Naturopathic medicine... Identifies the root causes of disease Uses the healing power of nature Addresses the whole person, not just symptoms Prevents illness and disease before it happens Sees the doctor as a teacher & guide Gives patients a voice in their health journey Stay Up-to-Date on Naturopathic Medicine Legislation and care options on naturopathic medicine change frequently. We'll keep you updated—sign up below. What is Naturopathic Medicine? Naturopathic medicine focuses on whole-patient wellness, using natural treatments to help the body heal itself. Naturopathic doctors (NDs) integrate conventional and natural medicine, covering all aspects of family health, from prenatal to geriatric care. A naturopathic practice seeks to empower individuals to achieve the type of health they deserve by taking more time to listen and make recommendations specific to their health goals. What is naturopathic medicine? Naturopathic medicine focuses on healing the body with its own natural systems. It is a combination of conventional and natural medicine resulting in client-centered care. Find a naturopathic doctor If you're looking for a doctor who doesn't just treat symptoms, but actually helps you identify root causes, a naturopathic doctor might be the perfect fit.
